channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Multiple incorrect signs, 2nd August
item.description:
Multiple incorrect signs have been installed at this location (near Lion King theatre). All the signs recently installed show mixed use pedestrian/cycle. However, there is no mixed use path here. There is a segregated cycle route Q1, and footways either side. Therefore the segregated signs (Left and Right sides accordingly) should be used. The only mixed use section is right at the bottom, the start of which is already marked by corduroy tactiles and an inlaid "mixed use" disk into the pavement. Here, possibly, a blue mixed use sign could be used, but only at the start of the mixed use section.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Wellington Street, Holborn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown grass, 2nd August
item.description:
This grass has overgrown for a few months now, children usually cut through the grass to save time going round it can cause alot of problems, this grass needs cutting down
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gascoyne Drive, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven road surface, 2nd August
item.description:
Probably the bumpiest and most uneven road surface in London. To the point it is nigh impossible to cycle on.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Grove Hill Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven pavement/road restoration., 2nd August
item.description:
Whilst turning from Grove Hill Road to Camberwell Grove my bike slipped on the uneven surface and broke and I fell under a car (I was alright). The surface needs to be either entirely tarmac or the paving stones need to be restored.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Grove Hill Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown weeds & nettles encroaching toward my garden, 1st August
item.description:
This piece of land is never maintained. I hav to keep calling it in. Its an eyesore and needs to be weeded NOT weak weedkiller that did absolutely nothing last time I reported. The bed needs to be raked/dug out properly. It needs to on a maintenance round. I'm fed up calling it in. This is council land!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34, Barham Road, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant fly tipping continues, 1st August
item.description:
All the huge wooden sheets from earlier in week still there, now more broken planks, plus a dirty old toilet, more cabinets and furniture dumped. DO SOMETHING. INSTALL CCTV. PROSECUTE FLY TIPPERS. ADD A GATE. PROVIDE PROPER BINS

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Monteagle Way, Hackney, London

item.title: Mattress Dumped on Turfed Area, 1st August
item.description:
An unwanted mattress has been left dumped on the turfed area by the path leading from Southport Road towards Elmley Street. I previously reported this on 29 June 2025 (FixMyStreet Ref.: 7776295), and four weeks on it is still there and gathering mould. Can the local team please remove it. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southport Road, Plumstead, London

item.title: Flytipped electrical items, 1st August
